page.title: 17BRITISH RAIL COVENTRY S.W.
page.content: Coventry is an{Inter-City}main line station through which trains from Shrewsbury or Wolverhampton pass on the way to Euston in London each half-hour.The maximum number of passengers to be found on a full ten coach train is 600.In 1 month 50000 passengers use the station.The station building,which is of modern design to match the city it serves,is run by an area manager and 130 staff.All food served at the station is provided by {'Travellers' Fare',}an independent concern.The{Travel Centre}was purpose built between 1980 and 1981 and has been fully computerised in the last year.Travel by boat as well as train can be arranged throughout the British Isles and Europe.Trips for people visiting relatives in the Middle or Far East can be arranged.The plan is to offer package deals within 5 years.
